import Platform from"react-native-web/dist/exports/Platform";import NativeModules from"react-native-web/dist/exports/NativeModules";var RNDeviceInfo=NativeModules.RNDeviceInfo;if(Platform.OS==='web'||Platform.OS==='dom'){RNDeviceInfo=require("../web");}if(!RNDeviceInfo){if(Platform.OS==='android'||Platform.OS==='ios'||Platform.OS==='web'||Platform.OS==='dom'){throw new Error("@react-native-community/react-native-device-info: NativeModule.RNDeviceInfo is null. To fix this issue try these steps:
  • For react-native <= 0.59: Run `react-native link react-native-device-info` in the project root.
  • Rebuild and re-run the app.
  • If you are using CocoaPods on iOS, run `pod install` in the `ios` directory and then rebuild and re-run the app. You may also need to re-open Xcode to get the new pods.
  If none of these fix the issue, please open an issue on the Github repository: https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-device-info");}}export default RNDeviceInfo;
